title: Drawing, Title Page, Part 9, from an Album of Drawings, the Gaspero Méndez de Haro y Guzman Collection, after 1682
title_raw: Title Page, Part 9, from an Album of Drawings, the Gaspero Méndez de Haro y Guzman Collection
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush; blue-gray and brown washes; brown ruled lines; traces of black chalk on heavy brown laid paper, lined
markings:
A black stamp with an escutcheon, probably that of the Marchese de Carpio, has been applied below three times. Below, at right, is a violet mark: compass and square below which are the letters J.P "419" is written in red crayon in the upper left corner. In the lower right corner of the cardboard of the mounting a collector's mark.

Gasparo Haro-Guzman; Julius Beitscher (Lugt S. 1409c); R.L (unidentified collector's mark on lining). Written in red ink: "n.2"
inscribed: The door has been cut out and replaced by a piece of paper with the inscription: "PARTE NONA/ DE DISEGNI DI SCELTI AUTORI/ Raccolti in ROMA/Dal Ecc. mo Signore D. Gasparo d'Haro e Guz. n Marchese del Carpio e Heliore. Del/Conseglio di Stato della Maestà Catt. ea/ DI CARLO II./Suo Ambasciatore Ordinario et Extraord. io/ Alla Santità di Nostro Signore/ PAPA INNOCENCO XI./ E nel 1682. Eletto Vice Rè e Capitano/Gererale/ DEL REGNO DI NAPOLI".
provenance: Purchased, The Mary Hearn Greims Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. Two storeys, the lower one with pilasters of Doric order, the upper one with pilasters of Ionic order. The door frame shows a broken pediment with an escutcheon in the center, with a winged skull on top. Laterally are niches showing statues of DEATH in front of trophies, the left one referring to worldly power, the right one to ecclesiastical dignitaries. In the central panel of the upper storey is a circular window. In the lower wedges are represented souls in Purgatory, in the upper ones two Blessed ascending to Heaven. St. Michael stands upon the Devil, recumbent, upon the entablature of the lower storey. In the lateral panels are windows, with volutes below, in front. On top is a triangular pediment. In its front and in that of the entablature is the Virgin with the Child, sitting upon clouds. The base of the Cross is shown above.

participants.person_name: Gasparo Mendez de Haro y Guzman

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Title Page, Part 9, from an Album of Drawings, the Gaspero Méndez de Haro y Guzman Collection, after 1682. Pen and brown ink, brush; blue-gray and brown washes; brown ruled lines; traces of black chalk on heavy brown laid paper, lined. 
1940-21-43
